skill.name: ios-debugger-agent
skill.description: Use XcodeBuildMCP to build, run, launch, and debug the current iOS project on a booted simulator. Trigger when asked to run an iOS app, interact with the simulator UI, inspect on-screen state, capture logs/console output, or diagnose runtime behavior using XcodeBuildMCP tools.
skill.summary: Use XcodeBuildMCP to build, run, launch, and debug the current iOS project on a booted simulator. Tr...
skill.author: Dimillian

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure prompt definition file (SKILL.md) with no executable code. It provides workflow guidance for using XcodeBuildMCP tools but does not perform any file operations, network requests, or command execution itself.

content.value_statement: Building and testing iOS apps on simulators requires navigating XcodeBuild commands, simulator controls, and debugging workflows. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for building, running, and debugging iOS apps using XcodeBuildMCP tools.
actual_capabilities: Build and run iOS projects on booted simulators
Interact with simulator UI (tap, type, swipe, gestures)
Capture and analyze app logs and console output
Diagnose runtime behavior and troubleshoot issues
limitations: Requires XcodeBuildMCP server to be running
Requires project path and scheme configuration

use_cases.title: Test Apps During Development
use_cases.description: Build and test iOS apps on simulators without needing physical devices

use_cases.title: Perform Automated UI Testing
use_cases.description: Interact with app UI programmatically and capture logs for test verification

use_cases.title: Automate iOS Build Verification
use_cases.description: Integrate simulator builds into CI/CD pipelines for automated testing

prompt_templates.title: Build and Run App
prompt_templates.prompt: Build and run my iOS app on the simulator. Check if a simulator is booted first.

prompt_templates.title: UI Interaction
prompt_templates.prompt: Describe the current UI, then tap the login button and type test credentials into the username field.

prompt_templates.title: Capture Logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Start logging for my app, launch it, and capture console output for 30 seconds showing any errors.

prompt_templates.title: Diagnose Crash
prompt_templates.prompt: My app crashes on launch. Check the logs, describe the UI state, and help diagnose what is causing the crash.

output_examples.input: Launch my app and tap the settings button
output: Checking for a booted simulator... Found iPhone 15 booted.
Getting app path and bundle ID for your project...
App launched successfully. Describing current UI...
Found Settings button with id 'settingsBtn'. Tapping it now.
Settings screen loaded. What would you like to do next?

best_practices: Verify a simulator is booted before attempting any build or run operations
Set session defaults with project path, scheme, and simulator ID for consistent operations
Capture logs before and after reproducing issues to trace root causes
anti_patterns: Skipping the booted simulator check and attempting operations blindly
Using coordinates for tapping instead of element IDs or labels when available
Ignoring log output after builds or app launches

faq.question: What platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code on macOS with Xcode and XcodeBuildMCP installed.

faq.question: Can I debug physical iOS devices?
faq.answer: No. This skill only supports iOS simulators, not physical devices connected via USB.

faq.question: How do I configure XcodeBuildMCP?
faq.answer: Install the XcodeBuildMCP server and ensure it runs alongside your AI tool before using this skill.

faq.question: Is my data safe when capturing logs?
faq.answer: Logs are captured locally from the simulator. No data is sent to external servers by this skill.

faq.question: Why is my app not launching?
faq.answer: Check that a simulator is booted, the project path and scheme are correct, and the app built successfully without errors.

faq.question: How is this different from Xcode's debugger?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-assisted workflows using MCP tools. It complements Xcode's debugger with automated UI interaction and log capture.
